title: That's not how you fixe Rylai
body:
Not by doing it a high damage option.

How is your mind working? Right now 90% of Rylai abuser doesn't give a shit about Hp, and they're all high burst damage except few one.
How is Rylai losing HP in favor of more offensive stats is going to prevent {{champion:69}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:134}}  +any other mages from slowing you and dealing tons of damage?

"Having all your abilities slow is something that should be a deliberate choice you opt into, and make trade offs for, not just a default item on so many AP champs"

Yes because they can have access to 100 AP which increase their burst damage with a luden lvl of AP

"That issue's magnified by the HP given by Rylai's, given health's the most universal stat we've got (everyone can always use it, and more's always useful, even if it's not the ideal stat for a specific champ)."

the fuck is this? no one is building Rylai beside mages, some bruiser are building it like {{champion:8}} {{champion:82}} , but most of champs buying Rylai are **MAGES** . Shifting the HP to other offensive stats is going to remove 2 or 3 people buying Rylai while they aren't a problem.
while making {{champion:69}}  and some piece of shit slowing you from 800 range with no downside.

you're going to fuck up massively again.

lowering the health on the item and adding other caster stats like mana or cdr hits the champions who arent a problem with the item while making it even better for those who abuse the shit out of it.

the only change that would come from this is that the 2 or 3 champions who bought the item for the stats are nerfed and it becomes even more of a core item on every other mage.

nerfing the health for mana and cdr hits the wrong champions, and just makes it a rush item on champions who abuse the passive.

Its both the passive and the champions in question. 

Many champions used to have their single target abilities considered as AoE or even DoT for the purposes of spellvamp and Rylai's. 

They removed that on Cass after she was unanimously considered utter garbage last rework in a sad attempt to make her viable. They never restored that little restriction with her latest rework. 

A few other champions got this benefit as a 'buff' when they were weak without Riot realizing that there was a reason for it being there in the first place.

___________

However, the reason its such a strong item right now is the AP that it offers more than specific champion interactions.

The point of my post was that SV is slowly becoming more and more inefficient on vladimir with the changes coming out. AKA it's being pushed out of his standard build.

Zhonyas abyssal and protobelt will be a very very weak AP count build unless combined with deathcap and void staff, which would then take out rylais (or vice verse rylais takes out either the staff or dcap).

the other stats help make up for the lower AP values in those three items plus the passives and actives are too desirable for Vlad to pass up.
He'll never be glass cannon anyway, he's far too short ranged and relies far too much on DPS, plus his new Higher AP ratios also give you the leeway to build those lower AP items and still get a fair amount of damage out of the deal

LCS =/= Solo Q vlad

The reason Vlad is picked in LCS is the same reason why Tahm, Lulu, Zilean, etc often find there way into LCS if they're viable at all: because they're _super_ safe and boring. Vlad rushes SV in LCS so he can farm safely at little to no penalty and eventually he'll scale from csing safely all game

LCS vlad is a snoozefest

Fortunately, Riot realizes this and they are constantly trying to readjust him back into a fun champion (like the most recent set of changes)

let me rephrase, every vladimir i see builds SV first, Tides of Blood a vladimir main in plat builds SV in every vlad games on his match history, that's not situational.

and builds do matter in lcs, because they build the best items in the game.

I don't care about what a single plat vlad main builds

I don't care about what "the pros" build

People have been copying the pros' Vladimir build for months, and he has sat at a sub 45% winrate for just as long (direct correlation). Playing the game the same way the LCS plays it doesn't work in a chaotic Ranked environment; this has been proven time and time again.

Spirit Visage is a good item, Spirit Visage is good on Vlad, rushing Spirit Visage/Zhonyas _every_ game on Vlad is just... stupid.

lol wut? I don't think you're aware of what spirit visage does. 

you can be wrong and not angry, just move on from this conversation
Okay then, keep playing Vlad the way you're playing him and keep enjoying that global average 45% winrate.

hey man, if you have some secret vladimir build that's going to take him over 50% winrate then feel free to share. 

If you don't and just want to bash everyone that builds spirit visage then I don't really see the purpose behind this conversation.

Thanks man

It's kind of comical that I'm getting flamed for not playing one of the lowest winrate champions correctly, even though the data for patch 6.20 hasn't even been released so nobody has any evidence to back themselves up.

Maybe it's not build that's a problem. I personally take 3x Movespeed Quints, Storm Raider's Surge, AND Ghost/TP (I don't like flash on him and TP is safer laning).

Giving it Mana and CDR won't hurt the prime Rylais abusers, heck, it may even benefit them.
What removing the health does is to just exclude a certain champion group from ever buying Rylais, all of which aren't really exploiting it like others do and really rely on the slow and survivability instead of the pure damage the mages are after
({{champion:8}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:82}} )

The great AP purge made Rylais one of the biggest AP chunks there when it used to be a defensive 80 AP option where things like 100 and 120 AP items existed.

I feel lowering its damage and giving Ludens a bit more would really help amend this issue while changing the stats slightly (60-80 AP, 400+ hp)

Riot will almost certainly do more bad than good if they change it to the squishy option, having to rebalance messes like Mordekaiser, Vlad, Rumble, A Sol and about 30 more champions.

Just making it less attractive and nerfing the slow, especially the AoE one to 30% would be ENOUGH!

//rant
congrat that's exactly what op said
Precisely.

>I feel lowering its damage and giving Ludens a bit more would really help amend this issue while changing the stats slightly

**Don't** buff Luden's

Right now, Luden's is only built on poke champions and roaming champions; it already has a niche and it fills it very well.

Buff Luden's and you'll see it built on literally every AP champion, just like season 5

What they need to do for it is to drop the AP down to 80 (or even 70 like the other AP safety item {{item:3157}}). Then they need to reduce the slow strength on AoE abilities, either a lower slow % or lower duration for this would be fine. As compensation for those sizable nerfs is compensate it in cost, build path and/or Health. 

It should be intended for champions like Kennen, Swain, or Vlad who want to be in the middle of the enemy team, not for champions like Ahri or Syndra who'd rather sit at the edge of a fight.
This is completely and totally false. The fact that mages can buy it to get a huge amount of AP, HP (survivability) and the passive is the problem. It needs to be a glass cannon item.

Easy coming from an Azir/Viktor main, huh?

Edit: sorry about that, I'm just really scared how these changes will impact Mord. After the Juggernaut patch he was in an awful state and him actually being in a good spot right now makes me very defensive of him. My apologies for that comment.

Doesn't make my point any less true. 

The power of being able to grab the giant belt component in difficult matchups that will eventually build into a 100 AP instead of grabbing seekers/negatron which build into items that provide 60/70 AP respectively is absolutely huge. It might be irrelevant for Azir but its certainly not on Cass/Viktor.

Mages wouldn't bother getting that early giant belt if it would severely impact their damage output.

Rylais got too much AP for what its niche's supposed to be.
People would rush Zhonyas/Abyssal just as often if they provided one HUNDRED AP.

Its stats are severely out of balance and should be reevaluated.

Hell, if it were up to me Rylais would become two different items.
One squishier damage option with a ton of AP and one tankier one with a stronger slow

It would benefit both parties while making you chose between damage or durability

An alternative route would be to to stop nerfing AP every major patch.

A year ago RCS was a core on selected few champions. Now it's a norm.
The funny thing is nothing changed about Rylai's since then.

So what did?
Nerf to RoA.
Nerf to Zhonya.
Nerf to Abyssal Scepter.
Also indirect nerfs to Deathcap and Luden's from AP on other items being reduced. Squishy AP builds are harder to make and less rewarding when you do attempt them.
poor {{champion:136}}

tbh I think tankiness + utility is always a recipe for disaster when making damage dealer items. Abyssal Scepter lets you deal more damage and be more tanky against magic, that's fine. Zhonya's making you more tanky towards physical and giving you even more survivability with an immunity active is fine, if not a bit crazy.

On the other hand, slows benefit the entire team, detriment all enemies, and have versatile uses. It can be built by someone far behind and still be useful, and it can be built by someone ahead and be as useful as rabadon's and void staff. It should be made into a purely utility item with CDR, mana and only 60 AP, or a glass cannon item with 100 AP *only* with maybe a few other stats like movespeed, MPen or something and a much cheaper price.

The final solution is to not let it be a damage dealer's item at all, and make the AP 30-50 AP, converting it into an AP bruiser item. Tankiness + utility is alright with bruisers, just not with damage dealers, as it implies the item also meets the minimum damage requirements to be a carry item. As someone who's built Zz'rot on Soraka and considers BoC on Anivia on a regular basis, (... And was among the first to notice how frost queen's claim can be used by AP mids...), I'll find a way to get it into my main build anyway, even if it means having crap damage.

Rylais is supposed to be a defensive utility item like zonyas. The HP on Rylais shouldn't be touched but the ap should be lowered to 60-80 and have like 10% cdr added to it. I am not sure what riot is planning but this item shouldn't be focused as an ap nuke item but rather a niche utility item that's core on certain champions and a decent items on most mages. Rylais is technically the new zonyas where every champion purchased because 120 ap and lost its unique niche pick. If you want more cc then you should give up some damage to balance things out not a simple win/win. Imagine of frozen mallet gave 60 ad, that would be disgusting beyond believe and every adc who wasn't ashe would build it every game because of health and heavy ad. Don't get me wrong I love Rylais but it's getting annoying how every mage is building it because the only downfall to this item is the price. 

Suggestions:
60-75 ap
Unique: 10% cdr or slow reduction  
Passive remains the same or maybe can receive a diminishing return on spam abilities
Builds out of kindle gem, blasting wand and giants belt, this build would make more sense since needlessly large rod is always a heavy ap item build, also adds more cdr options to mana less champions since cdr shouldn't be exclusive to mana mages since adc technically already have a large sum of cdr available to them and they really shouldn't have that option over mana less mages.

> How is your mind working? Right now 90% of Rylai abuser doesn't give a shit about Hp

Congratz, you failed at brain logic.


Lots of DMG -> people (mages) die off fast

Lots of DMG -> Some way to bulk up for for example **400 HEALTH** , while not losing much of damage -> Mage survive


This whole "Rylai rush" is caused by players trying to survive retarded damage ADCs dish out.
Want it gone?

1. Reduce AP ratio AND price on Rylai (hard)
2. Overall reduce damage ADCs do by 20%
3. Promote OTHER items for mages they could use instead of Rylais.

No one is rushing Rylais to defend against ADC, your logic makes no sense.

These Rylais abusers gives 0 fuck about hp, they are mid long range burst/dps mages who kites the living dhit out of you with perma slow from rylais and short cd dmg abilities.

> they are mid long range burst/dps mages

Who happen to be also squishy AF.
They can easily kill an adc before the adc kills them in early mid stage of the game, they don't rush rylais for the hp.

sigh..

Look, if Rylai was bought only cause of slow & AP, then it'd have been spammed since season 0.
But for some **WEIRD** reason it begun being (ab)used second after Riot overbuffed damage.

Mages don;t build tank-items. Nor HP-based items such as warmogs. They try to maximize usefullnes of items that provide necessary stats, right?

Then if they die too fast, **CAUSE THEY DO,** then obviously, they will try to find some solution for their squishy'ness. 

You still disagree? You still think Cassiopeia needs her spammable slow from Rylai (which, obviously, is abusing this item), then remove health from rylai along with proper price drop. You'll see Rylai becoming next trash-tier, never used item.

You clearly has no idea about the history of the game.

Rylais was shit tier until they buffed it and changed the build path from blasting rod to needlessly large rod. meaning MORE AP.
